content: Ask your family for a recommendation. I used a local bank in Iowa where I enlisted from, an account that I opened for a summer job when I was about 17, and their debit/MasterCard has served me well for the last ten years. It's worked everywhere from Slovenia to Kuwait to Argentina to Nepal, and they don't even charge me for overseas withdrawals, although I think that may be because they don't GET very many. The advantage to a smaller local bank is that when you call them to deal with an issue, you will get a human being pretty quickly. The DISadvantage is that they likely don't have anyone to answer the phone after banking hours, which is inconvenient when you are deployed overseas. Ask if the bank has online banking/billing, that is very useful for a servicemember.

title: Going to BCT where should i get a bank acct for direct deposit.

content: If you already have an account then use that one. Do not start up another one if you don't need to. USAA is an option but so you are aware there is only one place in San Antonio to do your deposits. You must either mail them in or if you qualify (you need a line of credit to be allowed to do this through credit card, mortgage, loan, insurance) a scan deposit where you scan the check and put it into your account. If you do not have that then the only other option is the first where you mail it in. There is usually credit unions on base that you can use or even a national bank that has branches all over the place. Navy Federal Credit Union is now open to all branches and DoD workers and has branches on Army & AF bases. They offer a similar program of no ATM charges on accounts for AD personnel. They also have programs for mortgages, purchasing a car, etc...
